Description:
The DeviceRequest resource describes a request for a patient to employ a medical device. This resource applies only to external devices, such as wheelchairs or hearing aids.

The search interaction enables the client to query for requests based on a specified set of information. The DeviceRequest Search endpoint allows clients to establish an identifier for a request without previously receiving unique identification from the server for the request.

patient.Name: patient
patient.Description:
Patient identifier for the patient who is the target of the request

This property is always required by Epic.

status.Name: status
status.Description:
The status of a request. Can be one of the following:

  • active
  • completed
  • draft
  • cancelled
  • unknown

If unspecified, returns requests of all statuses.

Bundle.Name: Bundle
Bundle.Description: Resource bundle. For more information, refer to the FHIR specification.

authoredOn.Name: authoredOn
authoredOn.Description: The date on which a request was made, or the day of the order that contains it.

basedOn.Name: basedOn
basedOn.Description: Reference to the parent order that contains a request.

codeCodeableConcept.Name: codeCodeableConcept
codeCodeableConcept.Description:
Standard API for SNOMED code of a procedure.

This element also sends CPT, CBV, THL, Kuntaliitto codes. If a value is not found, it will send the procedure ID as the code.

encounter.Name: encounter
encounter.Description: Reference to the encounter where a device was ordered.

intent.Name: intent
intent.Description:
The intent for this request. Can be one of the following:

  • order
  • proposal
  • plan

occurrencePeriod.Name: occurrencePeriod
occurrencePeriod.Description: The period during which an order is active.

end.Name: end
end.Description: The end of the requested period of device use.

start.Name: start
start.Description: The start of the requested period of device use.

orderStatus.Name: extension
orderStatus.Description:
Includes an order's status, specific to Netherlands environments. Statuses include:

  • Ordered (Order geplaatst)
  • Requested (Aangevraagd)
  • Pending (In afwachting van uitvoering)
  • In progress (In uitvoering)
  • On hold (Opgeschort)
  • Cancelled (Geannuleerd)
  • Noshow (Niet nagekomen)

priority.Name: priority
priority.Description:
The priority of a request. Can be one of the following:

  • routine
  • urgent
  • asap
  • stat

requester.Name: requester
requester.Description: The provider responsible for making the request.

status.Name: status
status.Description:
The status of a request. Can be one of the following:

  • active
  • completed
  • draft
  • cancelled
  • entered-in-error
  • unknown
